title: Florence Seyvos
text:
Florence Seyvos (born 1967 in <a href="Lyon">Lyon</a>) is a French <a href="novelist">novelist</a>, and screenwriter. Her films have been successful in French and in English.
Life.
Seyvos was born in Lyon in 1967 and lived in northern France. Seyvos published her first book for children after winning first prize in a short story competition. She has also written novels including "Les Apparitions" which was awarded the <a href="Prix%20Goncourt">Prix Goncourt</a> du premier roman) and "Un Garçon Incassable".
Seyvos collaborates on many of her screenplays with <a href="No%C3%A9mie%20Lvovsky">Noémie Lvovsky</a>, including <a href="Sentiments%20%28no%29">Sentiments (no)</a> and <a href="Camille%20Redouble">Camille Redouble</a>.
She has lived in the <a href="Ardennes">Ardennes</a>, in <a href="Ivory%20Coast">Ivory Coast</a>, <a href="Le%20Havre">Le Havre</a> and Paris.
